subject: computers
title: Simulated Annealing
subtitle: Annealing? Annealing metal?
content:
When you increase the temperature of a material, its molecules can freely move and get new positions. Then, when it cools down slowly, molecules positions are stabilized and the material can tolerate more pressure. It's due to the fact that the molecules have better formation. A researcher asked themselves, can we use this characteristic in solving hard problems? And after a while, they found the answer and the answer was a big YES. So, the basic idea is that, in the early stages of searching the solutions space, we may accept a bad solution instead of a good one that we found, and explore around the bad one. As we get to the final stages of our search, the probability of choosing bad solutions gets lower and we get more eager to explore around the good solutions we find. That's the idea, and then they implemented it in several languages and named it 'Simulated Annealing'. I have recently tried to implement the algorithm in MATLAB (I know, but I had to :\) to solve TSP problems. Take a look and enjoy. Link
Also, take a look at this video for better understanding:

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: America
content:
Geopolitics is learning how Geography can affect politics and international relations. The geographical attributes may be area, topography, demography, climate, natural resources or even applied science. Alfred Thayer Mahan (1840-1914) believed a country that has commercial and military control over the sea is powerful. That's why gaining control over choke points, canals, and coaling stations is very important. Mahan counted six conditions to have sea power:
  • Advantageous geographical position
  • Serviceable coastlines, abundant natural resources, and favorable climate
  • Extent of territory
  • Population large enough to defend its territory
  • Government with the influence and inclination to dominate the sea
Mahan believed that in central Asia there are still independent countries that survived, such as Turkey, Persia, Afghanistan, China, and Japan.
Nicholas J. Spykman believed that resources and population of Eurasia are far more than America. This can be extremely dangerous for America if one power rules one of the spheres of Europe or Asia. So America must seek a balance between powers in Eurasia. The beginning of the Cold War had two aspects, first, moral opposition to Communism and second, the geopolitical task of containing Soviet expansion, Kissinger said. America was the winner of the Cold War because it was for the first time that a non-Eurasian power balanced the powers in it.
Why not watch this movie to get a better insight with maps?

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: China
content:
China is after sea power in the South China Sea. That's why Taiwan is absolutely important to China. After stabilizing its economy, China wants to play a more important role in global affairs. China initiated the One Belt One Road project to achieve this objective. By having access to the ocean, having better access to Central and West Asia can increase its power exponentially.
Reference: https://imageio.forbes.com

The communism idealogy seems to be not blaring the vision of politicians in China. They are collaborating with liberal countries to move toward their goals. The Belt Road Initiative is an ambitious project to achieve oil and gas in the Middle East. It should be noted that China has also created the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to compete with the World Bank. Currently, Cybersecurity and Social Media apps play important roles in the relation between China and the U.S. and tension between them may arise based on these two issues. There have been large censorships in China towards U.S. Social Media apps. Until now, China has challenged none of Russian interests in Central Asia. Take a look at the following video to get more details about Belt Road Initiative:

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: Canada
content:
I have recently moved to Canada. Somehow I found it very interesting how the geography shaped the Canada population, economic and policies. There are two major geographical features in Canada, The Canadian Shield and the Rocky mountains range. The first one shaped the population growth in Ontario, Quebec and Manitoba. There is no possibility for agricultural or infrastrutural growth in the sheild region. So, it has stayed inhabitable. It also created a gap between the Ontario and eastern provinces and the praries (which consists of Alberta, Saskatchuan and Manitoba). This gap has bring differences in culture, infrastructure, population and also other features of the society. There is also the Rocky mountain range in the west of praries. This high altitude mountain, has made a barrier between other parts of the Canada and the British Columbia province. It's fascinating how Canada stayed unified during all these years with these gaps in between the country. The praries region has more connection with the Canada's southern neighbor because there is no barrier in the southern parts of Canada. Most of the population has been concentrated in the east coast. so, there is a lack of good transportation infrastructure between eastern regions and the rest of Canada. The government has to disperse the population toward the central regions and concentrate to provide better transportation infrastruture. Because of the global warming there is going to be a new wave of immigrations because of the weather, and the current peaceful situtation may not stay the samI have recently moved to Canada. Somehow, I find it very interesting how the geography shaped the Canadian population, economy and policies. There are two major geographical features in Canada; The Canadian Shield and the Rocky mountains range.
The first one shaped the population growth in Ontario, Quebec and Manitoba. There is no possibility for agricultural or infrastructure growth in the shield region. So, it has stayed inhabitable. It also created a gap between the Ontario and eastern provinces and the prairies (which consists of Alberta, Saskatchuan and Manitoba). This gap has brought differences in culture, infrastructure, population and also other features of society. There is also the Rocky mountain range in the west of the prairies. This high altitude mountain has made a barrier between other parts of Canada and the British Columbia province. It's fascinating how Canada stayed unified during all these years with these gaps in between the country. The prairies region has more connections with Canada's southern neighbor because there is no barrier in the southern parts of Canada. Most of the population has been concentrated on the east coast. So, there is a lack of good transportation infrastructure between the eastern regions and the rest of Canada. The government has to disperse the population toward the central regions and concentrate on providing better transportation infrastructure. Because of global warming, there is going to be a new wave of immigration because of the weather, and the current peaceful situation may not stay the same for Canada as there may be some issues with separating apart different parts of Canada.

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: Germany
content:
Ratzel (1844-1904) stated that states are organic, growing and dynamic, based on the influence he got from Darwin. He concluded that static states are in decline. He was also agreed that sea power is needed because of its advantages. After Ratzek, several scientists expanded his theories and there were used in the propaganda of Nazi Germany. After this, German geopolitic was discredited.
Germany is located in the center of Europe with 7 navigable rivers. South of Germany is the Alpe mountains and north of it is the Baltic Sear. The rivers provide cheap tranpsrotation of goods and materials along their path and that's one of the main reasons Germany is the 3rd exporter in the World. This has brung with itself wealth for Germany government. The power in Germany is decentralized over the country. This is how Germany has been keeping its unity. But the wealth is not dispersed evenly, specially between west and east of the country, maybe due to their past. but 100% due to the rivers layout.
South of Germany is geographically have advantages, but north of it is a flat land that can be envaded from every direction. That's where EU and NATO come t help Germany with its borders in east and west, respectively.
Let's look at the map:

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: United Kingdom
content:
The UK has been one of the key players of the world that shaped it. It consists of 4 parts; England, Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales and they have been unified for 300 years. After England, Scotland is one of the most important members of the UK. The main objective of the UK is to maintain its access to the sea and also its sea power. So, they have been in a close relationship with the U.S. They have participated in several conflicts in support of the U.S. (29 conflicts in all continents). Currently, they act as a bridge between the U.S. and Europe. The U.K. must make sure that a power or unity does not occur in Europe. Because whenever there was a power in Europe, they invaded the U.K. and it became very vulnerable.
Reference: https://preview.redd.it

After the Brexit, U.K. managed to recover quickly with the help of the U.S. But now they have made issues with the Scotland and Northern Ireland. During the Brexit negotiations, the majority of Scotland and Northern Ireland people were in favor of staying in the EU zone. But, the government in London finally decided to exit from the EU. Although there have always been talks about independence in Scotland and Northern Ireland, but after Brexit, it seems like they are getting more serious. The COVID outbreak helped London with the impossibility of a new referendum in Scotland and Ireland. But after recovering from it, it seems like the U.K. has to act faster in order to prevent breaking into parts.
Let's take a look at the following video:

subject: computers
title: Kernels
subtitle: Machine Learning Classification
content:
Sometimes in a classification problem, features are tie to each other and have a non-linear relationship. In such situations, we can create additional features from the original ones in a way that they can be separated linearly. Suppose that we have the following features and classes:


Reference: https://www.jeremyjordan.me

As it can be seen in the right picture, they cannot be separated linearly. So, we add another feature based on the first two that can be separated linearly. This approach is called the Kernel trick. There are common kernel functions that can be used:
  • Linear
  • Polynomial 
  • Radial Basis Function
  • Sigmoid

subject: science
title: Geopolitics
subtitle: Iran
content:
I am an Iranian and it is very interesting to me how the geography dictates things to policy of countries. Iran is a fortress. Borders of Iran are limited to the mountain ranges surrounding it in West, East and North and the Persian Gulf limiting it from the South. Iran has been known for its oil. Although it should be a wealthy country, it has a very low GDP. The main problem of Iran is its mountains. Iran needs plain for its population and I think that's why Iran invested so much in Iraqi Shia groups.
Reference: https://i.pinimg.com

The mountainous nature of Iran, also made it impossible to unify the country culturally. With mountains, creating transportation infrastructure becomes difficult. With poor infrastructure comes cultural, economical, religion and etc. differences. That's why Iran is the house of different ethnic groups. Ethnic groups can historically become a tool for superpowers to intervene in a country affairs. Currently, the U.S. has stablished several bases around Iran and tried to support separatist movements in Balochistan, Khuzestan, and Kurdistan.
Reference: https://upload.wikimedia.org

Iran is located in the Middle East, and this part of the World has always been in wars, conflicts, revolutions and so on. Iran has always used neighbor countries as proxies for its conflicts with others. Currently, Iran and Saudi Arabia are in conflict in Yemen, Iraq, Syria, and Libya. That's just like the conflicts the U.S. and the Soviet Union had between 1947 and 1991. Iran and Saudi Arabia are fighting for control over the Middle East. Super powers like U.S., British Empire and Russia have always intervened in Iran affair. Even, the U.S. performed a coup in 1953, against Mossadegh and killed the possibility of a democracy in Iran. After the Islamic revolution of Iran in 1972, Iran tried to get more control over the Middle East countries. After Iraq invasion to Iran, the Saudi Arabia supported Iraq. Iraq was acting as a buffer between Iran and Saudi Arabia until the U.S. invaded Iraq and ruined that buffer. Iran supported armed Shia groups in Iraq and Saudi Arabia supported armed Sunni groups. The same thing happened in Tunisia, Bahrain, Libya, Lebanon, Yemen, and even Morocco.
Beside all the things I mentioned above, Saudi Arabia has a good relationship with the World superpower, the U.S. U.S. supports the Saudi Arabia with warfare, maritime security and most importantly, with media. On the other hand, Iran sticks with the Russia which is in constant struggle. Saudi Arabia has recently used media to aggressively increase the tension between ethnic groups in Iran and support separatist movements.
Iranian government is doing the following actions to control the country:
  • Establishing a repressive security capability to control the ethnic and religious tensions inside
  • Manipulate ethnic and religious tensions in Iraq and Afghanistan
  • Move to create a nuclear force
